general_advisory: Farmers are advised to grow short duration Rabi crops like Green gram, Black gram, Cowpea, Field pea, Lentil, Groundnut, Toria and Sunflower in medium/shallow lowlands utilizing the available soil moisture in the field. Farmers are advised to visit their crop fields regularly to check pest infestation.

advisory: Ear Head Caterpillar - To control ear head caterpillar, spray Chlorpyriphos 50 % + Cypermethrin 5 % EC @ 400 ml/acre or Profenophos 50 % EC @ 400 ml/acre. As the pest is nocturnal in behaviour, spraying of pesticide should be done in the evening hours for better results.

Gundhi Bug Management - To control Gundhi Bug, spray Chlorpyriphos 20% EC @ 400 ml/acre or Malathion 50 % EC @ 400 ml/acre by mixing in 200 litres of water. Dusting of Chlorpyriphos 1.5 % D @ 10 kg/acre or Malathion 5 % D.P @ 10 kg/acre should be done uniformly during morning hours when there is no or minimum wind.

Storage - Groundnut should be stored in polythene lined gunny bags with desiccant like fused Calcium Chloride @ 250 grams/30 kg of seeds. The sealed bags should be kept vertically inside a well-ventilated room at room temperature.

Internode borer management - To manage the pest, biological control with Trichogramma chilonis card @ 1/acre at weekly intervals for 6 times by splitting each card into 12 pieces at the given perforations. Chemical control involves spraying Fipronil @ 600 ml/acre or Chlorantraniliprole 0.4 GR @ 4 kg/acre by mixing in 200 litres of water. Additionally, apply Chlorantraniliprole 0.4 GR @ 4kg/acre by mixing with 8 kg of sand.

Fruit fly - To manage fruit fly in cucurbits, prepare a poison bait by mixing 400 grams Jaggery and 8 ml DDVP in 4 litres of water. Keep this mixture in Plastic cups or clay pots @80 nos/acre. The fruit flies will be attracted to this and eventually get killed by falling into the poison baits.

Fertilizer Management - Apply 20 DAT and 33 kg of urea and 23 kg of MOP per acre after hoeing and hand weeding at 15-20 DAT. If Borax was not applied during transplanting of seedlings, then spray Borax @ 4 kg/acre or Folibor /Solubor @ 1.5 gram/litre. Spraying of Boron micronutrient should be done after two weeks of transplanting and two weeks before curd formation.

To manage Red Spider Mites in flowers like Marigold and Rose, spray wettable sulphur 80 % WP @ 2 gram/litre of water or Propargite 57 % EC @ 2 ml/litre of water or Fenpyroximate 5 % EC @ 2 ml/litre of water.
